page.title: 01OSTAIG, SKYE: COLLEGE,SCHOOL
page.content: The land at Ostaig contains enclosed, but not recently improved fields, a conifer plantation and some mature trees. There are 5 private houses and 2 centres of Education which exemplify above all else the amazing rejuvenation of the local community. Sleat Primary School (Bun Sgoil Schleite) was opened in 1983 with 70 children, replacing the old Ferrindonald school which could no longer cope with increasing numbers. There are three, Gaelic speaking staff and 3 itinerant teachers. A move is afoot to create a Gaelic speaking intake to primary 1 in 1986. The farm buildings at Ostaig were aquired by Mr. Iain Noble as part of Fearann Eilean Iarmain. It was slowly renovated as a Gaelic college doing short courses from the mid 1970s. In 1983 it accepted the first 8 students
